attribs.name: strength_check_mod_formula
attribs.current: -1[str mod with bonus] + 1[jack of all trades] + (@{global_check_bonus})[global check bonus]

attribs.name: dexterity_check_mod_formula
attribs.current: 3[dex mod with bonus] + 1[jack of all trades] + (@{global_check_bonus})[global check bonus]

attribs.name: constitution_check_mod_formula
attribs.current: 1[con mod with bonus] + 1[jack of all trades] + (@{global_check_bonus})[global check bonus]

attribs.name: intelligence_check_mod_formula
attribs.current: 1[int mod with bonus] + 1[jack of all trades] + (@{global_check_bonus})[global check bonus]

attribs.name: wisdom_check_mod_formula
attribs.current: 0[wis mod with bonus] + 1[jack of all trades] + (@{global_check_bonus})[global check bonus]

attribs.name: charisma_check_mod_formula
attribs.current: 2[cha mod with bonus] + 1[jack of all trades] + (@{global_check_bonus})[global check bonus]

attribs.name: repeating_classfeature_-KCthERg3m4HyHh3OUJi_freetext
attribs.current:
You can inspire others through stirring words or music. To do so, you use a bonus action on your turn to choose one creature other than yourself within 60 feet of you who can hear you. That creature gains one Bardic Inspiration die, a d6.
Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number rolled to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw it makes. The creature can wait until after it rolls the d20 before deciding to use the Bardic Inspiration die, but must decide before the GM says whether the roll succeeds or fails. Once the Bardic Inspiration die is rolled, it is lost. A creature can have only one Bardic Inspiration die at a time.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current:
I change my mood or mind, as quickly as i change key in a song.

Despite being a bard Zeed is like others of his race and take combat very seriously. This may seem strange to others when he is singing a funny song or telling a joke as a way to activate a spell while being completely focused on the task at hand. Outside of combat he is a very likable person and easy going. He is quite clueless when it comes to certain aspects of the material plane however.

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Honesty- Art should reflect the soul; it should come from within and reveal who we really are.

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I will do anything to prove myself superior to my hated rival.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current:
Im a sucker for a pretty face.

Claustrophobia- do to his nature he hates being in confined spaces. While inside of them he has to succeed in a roll or be given the frightened condition.
Driven by revenge- If it came down to it he would sacrifice everything to finally get answers from his brother.

attribs.name: proficiencies
attribs.current:
Light Armor
Simple Weapons 
  - hand crossbow
  - Rapier
  - Longsword
  - Shortsword

Musical Instrument(s)
  - didgeridoo
  - Lyre
  - Cowbell
  - Lute
Disguise Kit

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-KCtkRJrKdZTLbfz74LX_content
attribs.current:
If you have proficiency with a given musical instrument, you can add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make to play music with the instrument.

A bard can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus, substituting it for any material component that does not list a cost.

Each type of musical instrument requires a separate proficiency.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-KCtkgLKMZyEF6ZpYmUI_content
attribs.current:
Includes:

 a backpack

 a bedroll

 [[2]] costumes

 [[5]] candles

 [[5]] days of rations

 a waterskin

 a disguise kit.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-KCtkjHWzRjXyTuR--tz_content
attribs.current: A waterskin can hold up to [[4]] pints of liquid.

attribs.name: repeating_equipment_-KCtkoLucwqSZfknmsXl_content
attribs.current: For [[1]] hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for an additional [[5]] feet.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KCtl-BXmxizfbbYPTEY_target
attribs.current: Each object and creature in a 20-foot cube within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KCtl-BXmxizfbbYPTEY_content
attribs.current:
Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a Dexterity saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being invisible.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KCtqAU3TKb8Dq3Xaatw_content
attribs.current: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments at a creature you can see within range. If the target can hear you (thought it need not understand you), it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn. This spells damage increases by 1d4 when you reach 5th level (2d4), 11th level (3d4) and 17th level (4d4)

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KCtq6iN-3HlHAQiQZuW_materials
attribs.current: a small amount of makeup applied to the face as this spell is cast

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KCtq6iN-3HlHAQiQZuW_content
attribs.current: For the duration, you have advantage on all Charisma checks directed at one creature of your choice that isnt hostile toward you. When the spell ends, the creature realizes that you used magic to influence its mood and becomes hostile toward you. A creature prone to violence might attack you. Another creature might seek retribution in other ways (at the DMs discretion), depending on the nature of your interaction with it.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KCtq2DodTa4TXZgoGqo_content
attribs.current: You whisper a discordant melody that only one creature of your choice within range can hear, wracking it with terrible pain. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it takes 3d6 psychic damage and must immediately use its reaction , if available, to move as far as its speed allows away from you. The creature doesnt move into obviously dangerous ground, such as a fire or a pit. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and doesnt have to move away. A deafened creature automatically succeeds on the save.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KCtppmkR7IwSbv5g19F_materials
attribs.current: (tiny tarts and a feather that is waved in the air

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KCtppmkR7IwSbv5g19F_content
attribs.current:
A creature of your choice that you can see within range perceives everything as hilariously funny and falls into fits of laughter if this spell affects it. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or fall prone, becoming incapacitated and unable to stand up for the duration. A creature with an Intelligence score of 4 or less isnt affected. 
At the end of each of its turns, and each time it takes damage, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. The target has advantage on the saving throw ifits triggered by damage. On a success, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KDPZBYUd7ldT-l9VbxY_content
attribs.current:
This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8, the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose within range are affected in ascending order of their current hit points (ignoring unconscious creatures).

Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature affected by this spell falls unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap the sleeper awake. Subtract each creature's hit points from the total before moving on to the creature with the next lowest hit points. A creature's hit points must be equal to or less than the remaining total for that creature to be affected.

Undead and creatures immune to being charmed aren't affected by this spell.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, roll an additional 2d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KDPZBYUd7ldT-l9VbxY_target
attribs.current: Each creature inside a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KDPZBYUd7ldT-l9VbxY_materials
attribs.current: A pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket

attribs.name: traits_chat_var
attribs.current: {{Traits=[Bardic Inspiration](~repeating_trait_-kfhzrtpu9fdc0dcxi8n_trait)}}{{Traits=[Bardic Inspiration](~repeating_trait_-kfhzrtpu9fdc0dcxi8n_trait), [Jack of All Trades](~repeating_trait_-kgfp6xrawzvilp0xr68_trait)}}{{Traits=[Bardic Inspiration](~repeating_trait_-kfhzrtpu9fdc0dcxi8n_trait), [Jack of All Trades](~repeating_trait_-kgfp6xrawzvilp0xr68_trait), [Song of Rest](~repeating_trait_-kgfp6xtjm9ejeaqcefe_trait)}}{{Traits=[Bardic Inspiration](~repeating_trait_-kfhzrtpu9fdc0dcxi8n_trait), [Jack of All Trades](~repeating_trait_-kgfp6xrawzvilp0xr68_trait), [Song of Rest](~repeating_trait_-kgfp6xtjm9ejeaqcefe_trait), [Expertise](~repeating_trait_-kgfp6xubwzwejv5qv97_trait)}}

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KFgV5yBuWYg8EVXgCrr_target
attribs.current: Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from you

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KFgV5yBuWYg8EVXgCrr_content
attribs.current:
For the duration, you understand the literal meaning of any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any spoken language that you hear. You also understand any written language that you see, but you must be touching the surface of which the words are written. It takes about 1 minute to read one page of text.

This spell doesn't decode secret messages in a text or glyph, such as an arcane sigil, that isn't part of a written language.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KFgV5yBuWYg8EVXgCrr_materials
attribs.current: A pinch of soot and salt

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KGFp6xrawZVIlp0XR68_freetext
attribs.current: You can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KGFp6xrawZVIlp0XR68_display_text
attribs.current: You can add half your proficiency bonus, rounded down, to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KGFp6xtJm9eJeAQCEfe_freetext
attribs.current: You can use soothing music or oration to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures regains extra hit points.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KGFp6xtJm9eJeAQCEfe_display_text
attribs.current: You can use soothing music or oration to help revitalize your wounded allies during a short rest. If you or any friendly creatures who can hear your performance regain hit points at the end of the short rest by spending one or more Hit Dice, each of those creatures regains extra hit points.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KGFp6xubWZweJV5Qv97_freetext
attribs.current:
Choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 10th level, you can choose another two skill proficiencies to gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_trait_-KGFp6xubWZweJV5Qv97_display_text
attribs.current:
Choose two of your skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses either of the chosen proficiencies.
At 10th level, you can choose another two skill proficiencies to gain this benefit.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KGnrhVBvDFlodZwTi2i_materials
attribs.current: A piece of iron and a flame

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KGnrhVBvDFlodZwTi2i_content
attribs.current:
Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 fire damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn't drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

At Higher Levels: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KGnrshl17WZIRmdm4Lz_content
attribs.current: You craft an illusion that takes root in the mind of a creature that you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you create a phantasmal object, creature, or other visible phenomenon of your choice that is no larger than a 10-foot cube and that is perceivable only to the target for the duration. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. The phantasm includes sound, temperature, and other stimuli, also evident only to the creature. The target can use its action to examine the phantasm with an Intelligence (Investigation) check against your spell save DC. If the check succeeds, the target realizes that the phantasm is an illusion, and the spell ends. While a target is affected by the spell, the target treats the phantasm as if it were real. The target rationalizes any illogical outcomes from interacting with the phantasm. For example, a target attempting to walk across a phantasmal bridge that spans a chasm falls once it steps onto the bridge. If the target survives the fall, it still believes that the bridge exists and comes up with some other explanation for its fallit w as pushed, it slipped, or a strong wind might have knocked it off. An affected target is so convinced of the phantasms reality that it can even take damage from the illusion. A phantasm created to appear as a creature can attack the target. Similarly, a phantasm created to appear as fire, a pool of acid, or lava can burn the target. Each round on your turn, the phantasm can deal 1d6 psychic damage to the target if it is in the phantasms area or within 5 feet of the phantasm, provided that the illusion is of a creature or hazard that could logically deal damage, such as by attacking. The target perceives the damage as a type appropriate to the illusion.

attribs.name: repeating_spell_-KHOXzYGQ8ZbDXZi4Yc-_content
attribs.current: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters, including whatever they can perceive or have perceived within the past day. You might be able to persuade a beast to perform a small favor for you, at the DM's discretion.
